channel.title: The giant fan on blast pit.
channel.description:
Remember that giant fan on blast pit, and how the controls for it were UNDER the fan? so anyone who had to turn on the fan would have to make make a mad dash for the ladder, climb like hell and pray to god that the giant blades doesn't cut him in half. This would NEVER pass any modern day safety inspection!
I think in the black mesa mod the controls should be in a little control room or something. what do you think?

item.title: The giant fan on blast pit.
item.dc:creator: saivert
item.description:
taxi_evil:

What excellent and thoughtful discussion. Thanks. Really.

@OP: You aint been watching Freeman’s mind have you? If it was up to me, I’d have the controls where they are. Keep the workers on their toes

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=fqURJ0dw9EY (at 5 : 34 )

Read full topic

item.title: The giant fan on blast pit.
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
Though I bet your blades are smaller.

…Also, one of those blades should break off when it’s spinning up, to indicate how puny your fan is in comparison to the old bear of a faulty-angled rust-rotor.

item.title: The giant fan on blast pit.
item.dc:creator: Mr_Someguy
item.description:
Shnazliztur:

Has anyone noticed that one of the 3 blades faces the wrong direction? here’s a crude typing pic of what it looks like when it passes by ( < then < then >, *repeate ) So one blade of force is being made into wind that goes into the vents, that must of been a mapping woops or the BM research team sure isn’t thinking green that much!

Yes we have.

Read full topic

item.title: The giant fan on blast pit.
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
Right, can you imagine trying to build a mass spectrometer out of antimatter, and then keeping it stable? No wonder everything went to hell!!!

Read full topic
item.source: The giant fan on blast pit.

item.title: The giant fan on blast pit.
item.dc:creator: danielsangeo
item.description:
Raminator:

I was 13 when I played Half-Life for the first time, and the antimass spectrometer seemed kind of legit in a sci-fi kind of way. I spend most of my days elbow-deep in mass spectrometers now, and they are seriously about half the size of an average PC case. There are no lasers, there are no control rooms, there are no big rotating things. Totally underwhelming.

You see, that’s just regular mass spectrometer but the one in Black Mesa is an anti-mass spectrometer. :retard:

Read full topic

I was 13 when I played Half-Life for the first time, and the antimass spectrometer seemed kind of legit in a sci-fi kind of way. I spend most of my days elbow-deep in mass spectrometers now, and they are seriously about half the size of an average PC case. There are no lasers, there are no control rooms, there are no big rotating things. Totally underwhelming.

They are. Way too underwhelming…

item.title: The giant fan on blast pit.
item.dc:creator: Mr.Shadow
item.description:
I know, but something as ridiculous as black mesa (the facility, not the game) is something that I cannot see working out that way. It’s a game, but even as a game it doesn’t really makes sense at all.

item.source: The giant fan on blast pit.

item.title: The giant fan on blast pit.
item.dc:creator: Vatz
item.description:
peanutz:

Remember that giant fan on blast pit, and how the controls for it were UNDER the fan? so anyone who had to turn on the fan would have to make make a mad dash for the ladder, climb like hell and pray to god that the giant blades doesn’t cut him in half. This would NEVER pass any modern day safety inspection!

I think in the black mesa mod the controls should be in a little control room or something. what do you think?

Did anything about the original Black Mesa in Half-Life make any damn sense at all? You might as well ask why the ladder in the Office Complex-We’ve Got Hostiles transition elevator is on the opposite side of the shaft from the door, when it was put there in case you couldn’t reach the elevator. The guys who built BMRF were either idiots or sadistic.

Read full topic

item.source: The giant fan on blast pit.

item.title: The giant fan on blast pit.
item.dc:creator: andx0r
item.description:
mattemuse:

I was 2 when I installed my first HVAC and you, sir, are no HVAC/R apprentice

But I am! :pirate:

Ibanez:

Damn, man. You should have been around years ago. Those were the best ideas I’ve heard in a long time. Hell, you probably (hopefully not) just set back the level design of the duct-heavy portions of BM because you made the developers realize that everything in their realistic recreation is wrong. Last I checked they didn’t have an HVAC/R expert around to consult. :3

Which is why if I had been around back then, I just would’ve gone LALALALALA! with my fingers in my ears to encourage a faster release of the mod.

Raminator:

I was 13 when I played Half-Life for the first time, and the antimass spectrometer seemed kind of legit in a sci-fi kind of way. I spend most of my days elbow-deep in mass spectrometers now, and they are seriously about half the size of an average PC case. There are no lasers, there are no control rooms, there are no big rotating things. Totally underwhelming.

I suppose next a Marine is going to come in here and tell us everything about the military in HL1 is the reverse of what really happens. :fffuuu:

Read full topic

item.description:
Raminator:

I was 13 when I played Half-Life for the first time, and the antimass spectrometer seemed kind of legit in a sci-fi kind of way. I spend most of my days elbow-deep in mass spectrometers now, and they are seriously about half the size of an average PC case. There are no lasers, there are no control rooms, there are no big rotating things. Totally underwhelming.

i know what you mean when i found out what a spectrometer really was it was dissapointing …however, are mass spectrometers and anti-mass spectrometers two completely different things? If Anti-mass means Anti-matter then thats a dangerous thing and might require that to ‘hold’ it. it might be that the bigger the machine the better the results? it might find stuff which we have no idea about or something, i am hoping its different anyway and that its a real thing…i want one…it looks pretty

ah nvm it is a differnt and more impressive thing and i do want one…just checked this https://half-life.wikia.com/wiki/Anti-Mass_Spectrometer
